title: [LOGLAB-19] Unable to execute the final withdrawal due to utilizedAssets() not being zero
summary: This bug report discusses an issue with the `LogarithmVault._isWithdrawRequestExecuted()` function in the `LogarithmVault.sol` file. This function determines whether a user's withdrawal request can be executed and returns a boolean variable called `isExecuted`. However, an attacker can manipulate the state by transferring small amounts of tokens to the strategy and hedge manager contracts, causing the `utilizedAssets()` value to remain non-zero. This prevents the final withdrawal request from being executed. The report suggests clearing idle assets before checking the `utilizedAssets()` value as a possible solution. This bug has been fixed.
